cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi (135 km) ESE of Caibarien, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest later today, moving parallel to Cuba, then across the Florida Keys Sunday morning and northward up the Florida peninsula toward Georgia and the interior Southeast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys and then the southwest coast of Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect from north of Volusia/Brevard County Line, FL to Fernandina Beach, FL (no South Carolina coast at this time)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning and Storm-Surge Warning confined to Florida peninsula and Keys; no warnings posted north of Fernandina Beach
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia with possible effects extending into coastal South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible (up to a 24 % chance) late Monday night through Tuesday with only a small 4 % chance of 50-kt winds and 2 % chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Significant surge not currently forecast for the South Carolina coast, but minor inundation (<3 ft) cannot be ruled out if the track shifts eastward.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 4–6 inches of rain to the coastal plain of South Carolina, producing localized flash-flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and large swell Monday–Wednesday; isolated tornadoes possible in rain bands as the center passes to the west.
